pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:1.16.1: I translate in accordance with the findings of Oskar von Hinüber and Bhikkhu Anālayo in their paper “The Robes of a _Bhikkhunī_”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.2: [Sp.4.1227](): _Acchinnacīvarikāyātiādīsu saṅkaccikacīvarameva cīvaranti veditabbaṃ_, “Her robe is stolen, etc.: just the robe which is the chest cover is to be understood.” The “etc”, _ādisu_, refers to the following non-offense, “If her robe is lost”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.12.0: At this point the Pali reads _Dhammikavagga_ to indicate the last chapter of _pācittiya_ rules for the nuns. This indication is redundant in the present translation, since I have pointed out all the missing rules, including direct references to their counterparts in the chapter on _pācittiya_ rules for the _bhikkhus_.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc96:2.2.13.0: At this point the Pali reads _Nandasikkhāpada_ to indicate the last rule in the chapter of _pācittiya_ rules for the nuns. This indication is redundant in the present translation, since I have pointed out all the missing rules, including direct references to their counterparts in the chapter on _pācittiya_ rules for the _bhikkhus_.
